Quickstrike:





Quickstrike struggled against whatever had his leg. He pulled against it, 
trying to swim for the surface. He couldn't see what had his leg, but he 
tried to slash at it with the fangs at the end of his arm. From the feel of 
it, it was metal, and smooth. He kicked at it. It wasn't too stable, like it 
was flexable.

He didn't know how, but he mananed to get to the surface again. He coughed 
and screamed. He reached for Stingtra, but she was too far away. Another of 
the underwater things grabbed him around the shoulder. It looked like a 
golden segmented arm. The one on his leg and the one wrapped around his 
shoulder shoved him back down into the pitch black water. They pulled him 
fast into the water, barely able to fight against it. He felt another one 
brush against him. There were more under the water--going for Stingtra. But 
he couldn't do anything. After he saw the other arms, the blackness took 
over his vision. He knew they were pulling him to someplace.

>*Stingtra follows Quickstrike and than stares* Stingtra:...slag....
>*Stingtra is sumerged under water and pops her head up* Stingtra:
>Quickstrike? Quickstrike? Quickstrike!!?? *Stingtra dives under water
>looking for Quickstrike*
>

> > Quickstrike lead the way through the front part of the cave. It was 
>nearly
> > pitch black at the end of it. He activated his infra red vision to make 
>it
> > easier to see. The farther it walked down, the more confusing it got. It
> > looked like it went at a dead end.
> >
> > He stopped and tilted his head, musing at what was behind his optics.
>Below
> > him, he heard the slight trickle of water. He looked down and saw at 
>least
> > an inch of water touching his feet, enough to make the ridges on the
>bottom
> > of his feet disappear. He thought there must be a water source within 
>the
> > cave.
> >
> > Just as he was about to step ahead, he went down. It felt like the 
>ground
> > had collapsed--with the splash. The puddle of water that filled the hold
> > area turned into a pool. Quickstrike twisted and turned, trying to find
>what
> > way was up.
> >
> > He righted himself and tried his luck. His head surfaced, coughing from
> > surprise. After he got a breath, he felt something pull at him. There 
>was
>a
> > tug, then a violent yank. He was again pulled underwater. But this time 
>he
> > couldn't fight to get back up to the surface. Something had his leg,
>pulling
> > him.
